Laxmi SPRINGS: No safety accidents were reported from April to June, with zero incidents recorded each month.
Production loss due to material shortage was consistently zero in April, May, and June.
OK delivery cycles improved from 97.54% in April to 100% in both May and June.
The number of trips per month peaked at 25 in May, compared to 24 in April and 21 in June.
Machine breakdown hours and the number of machine breakdowns remained at zero for April, May, and June.
CAM: OK delivery cycles percentage decreased from 59% in January to 54% in March and April, then increased sharply to 80% in May.
Quantity shipped per month dropped significantly from 26,749 in January to 8,796 in March, before partially recovering to 13,899 in May.
Number of trips per month is only available for May, with a recorded value of 19, while data for January to April is missing.
Production loss due to material shortage, vehicle turnaround time, machine breakdown hours, and number of machines breakdown have missing data for all months from January to May.
No data is available for safety accident numbers from January to May, preventing assessment of safety performance during this period.
Daxter: There were zero safety accidents reported from January to May.
OK delivery cycles improved from 82% in January to a peak of 97% in March, then decreased to 88% in May.
The number of trips per month dropped from 75 in January to 48 in March, then slightly increased to 51 in May.
Quantity shipped per month increased from 24,369 units in January to a high of 30,342 units in April, before dropping to 26,383 units in May.
No machine breakdowns or machine breakdown hours were recorded from January to May.

The number of trips per month increased from 18 in January and February to a peak of 38 in April, then decreased to 27 in May and was not reported for June.
